Comments_List: I get a better understanding of some primary term to use in statistics. Also get to know how to apply them to analyze real problems. Learned to use R to clean tons of data and extract the information you want. Leanred some very basic R coding.

Basic stats knowledge
R
individual problem-solving ability
R & statistical skills
After taking this class, I become an R expert, learned knowledge on model selection and data analysis.
Learned an extensive amount about coding in R and some introductory data analysis techniques.
R, Data Processing

I have developed quantitative skills that allow me to analyze data using R programming and interpret the data scientifically. Courses related to statistical significance and linear model are particularly useful to me.
using R to do data analysis
Data analysis: binging out quick insights from large data sets using R
I learned a lot about coding in R and statistics that will be useful for my research.
R; data analysis; plot
How to use R for data analysis
I learned the fundamentals of R as a language and how to use basic concepts of statistics in application.
Improved statistical/data analysis, learned to be proficient in R.
I am now able to use R. I am also better at programming.

The teaching method in class is a good way to engage everyone and convey the concept, though sometimes would be a little bit hard to follow, especially for students who do not have R experience or statistics course experience or both before. The HW and exam is in a very reasonable difficulty and amount. 

Might allow more engaging if there is a mini project during the semester so students can collaborate and work on a small real problem??

Weakness:
There's only one weakness, I think at least one of the exams should be a time-limiting project-based exam. This could substantially improve our real-time data experience.

Strengths:
1. Insanely responsive instructor! Susan is doing really good on providing feedback on almost every student! This is incredible~!
2. Piazza made it wonderful to communicate with fellow students, Susan, and teaching assistants. Making it a very interactive class.
3. Very helpful homework problem sets.
4. Well-designed and -organized canvas tabs and lectures.

Lectures are clear and well-organized.
Some contents are overlapped with other basic statistic courses.
More focus on theoretical points are needed.
The content and the data sets are very interesting. However, I think the couse can be better by including individual projects.

Strengths: purposeful classes and kind, intelligent instructor.

Weaknesses: homework was a bit copy paste heavy from classwork, so I think less learning was gained from assignments than desired.

Strengths: 
1) Very interactive.
2) Homework is well-designed that helps our understanding of the statistical concepts better.

Weaknesses:
1) More contents could be included into the syllabus.

Strengths: 

A good overview of data analysis methods and tools that will help you keep learning on your own. 

Professor was excellent.

Weaknesses:

Professor wanted to cover too much material and went by a little fast for my preference. I felt there was too much material and too little time.

The class before the exams should be dedicated to reviews and QandAs.

Strength: Instructor was so clear in teaching

Weakness: Once you miss something in class, its almost impossible to catch back up so you are lost for the rest of the class period.
Very clear and efficient
I found this class to teach concepts that were very practical for use outside of the classroom. I think I will use tools I learned from this class for a long time.
Very wel taught and organized, homework and lectures were useful and interesting. No major complaints, though exam review sessions could have been better.

Strength:
It was taught for kinesthetic and visual learners. 

Weakness:
It often moved too fast during the lecture to keep up.
Yes. Very useful both in statistics and in R.
Strongly recommend for people looking to start on R
Highly recommended. Could learn lots of practical skills.
in case that they don't want to focus on theories, Yes.
I will recommend this course to other students. The course builds the foundation of data analysis.
Absolutely. I found the skills learned to be extremely useful, and this provides a good jumping off point for future statistical programming courses.
Yes
Yes, I would strongly recommend this course to other students who have interests in data analysis.
Yes, it is very useful for research
Yes I would. It s a strong course on introductory data analysis.
Learned a lot of useful R programming skills that will be useful to my research
Yes. Learnt a lot.
Yes, this is a great course for learning R.
Absolutely! I learned a number of extremely useful skills and I found it to be enjoyable and appropriately challenging.
Yes, but only if they needed it or something similar for their degree.
